full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 57 of 197 2598 LCHVMAX2 Richards - direct 1 A. Yes. 2 Q. Does that training and experience involve how to listen to people talk? 3 A. What we try to do is listen to get the details as accurate as possible. 4 Q. Okay. And when you're listening and trying to get the 5 details as accurate as possible, are you trying to gather 6 information via open-ended questions to elicit responses from 7 witnesses? 8 A. Yes. 9 Q. As part of your training and experience, do you try to 10 limit anybody from telling you anything? 11 A. No. 12 Q. And as part of your investigation and training, are you 13 looking to get as much relevant information as possible from 14 anyone you're interviewing about a particular topic or subject? 15 A. Yes. 16 Q. Now, I want to direct your attention to 2007, which would 17 be about a year after you began working in Palm Beach; correct? 18 A. Correct. 19 Q. You were working with an agent Nesbitt Kuyrkendall. Do you 20 recall Agent Kuyrkendall? 21 A. Yes. 22 Q. And you and Agent Nesbitt Kuyrkendall were interviewing 23 witnesses together in tandem; is that right? 24 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016786
